summary: This FBI 302 form documents a visit by a detective to the Palm Beach Police Department on October 8, 2021, to collect outstanding records related to investigations into Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The detective obtained two bankers boxes of case materials and digital records, which were later transferred to and from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in New York for discovery purposes.

persons.name: Sgt
persons.role: Supervisor of Palm Beach Police Department's Organized Crime, Vice & Narcotics Unit (Special Investigations)
persons.context: Sgt escorted the detective to a storage warehouse, provided access to and turned over Epstein-related case files stored in bankers boxes, and assisted in searching the digital case management system.

persons.name: Det
persons.context: The detective traveled to Palm Beach to obtain all outstanding records pertaining to Epstein/Maxwell investigations from the Palm Beach Police Department, received the materials, and later transported them to and from an AUSA in New York.

persons.name: AUSA
persons.role: Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: The detective delivered two bankers boxes of Epstein case materials to this AUSA in New York for discovery purposes on October 8, 2021, and collected them back on October 14, 2021.

connections.description: Detective traveled to Palm Beach to obtain investigation records from Sgt, who provided physical and digital case files related to Epstein and Maxwell.
Detective delivered evidence boxes to the AUSA for discovery purposes and later retrieved them to submit to FBI evidence.

events.title: Evidence Collection at Palm Beach PD
events.description: A detective visited the Palm Beach Police Department, was taken to a storage warehouse by Sgt, and obtained two bankers boxes of Epstein-related case materials and digital records.

events.title: Evidence Transfer to SDNY AUSA
events.description: At approximately 8:30 PM, the detective delivered the two bankers boxes of evidence to an Assistant U.S. Attorney at 1 Saint Andrews Plaza in New York for discovery purposes.

events.title: Evidence Retrieval from SDNY AUSA
events.description: At approximately 5:40 PM, the detective collected the two bankers boxes back from the AUSA in New York in order to submit them to FBI evidence.

locations: Town of Palm Beach Police Department, Palm Beach, Florida
Palm Beach Police Department's storage warehouse
1 Saint Andrews Plaza, New York, NY
keyFacts: The Palm Beach Police Department maintained a locked storage room specifically for its Special Investigations unit, where old or closed case files, including Epstein-related materials, were stored in bankers boxes.
Among the materials obtained was a 'trash pull' inside a clear plastic envelope marked '11-6-06', indicating evidence collected on November 6, 2006.
The detective's visit was specifically to obtain records pertaining to investigations into both Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, including a noted 2001/2002 investigation into Maxwell.

The evidence was physically transferred to and from an Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York, highlighting ongoing federal legal proceedings related to the Epstein case in 2021.
The document confirms the Palm Beach Police Department had both physical case files and a digital case management system containing records related to the Epstein/Maxwell investigations.
